p: At this phase, analgesics, opioids, NSAIDs, and corticosteroids may be instituted for refractory or recurrent cases or as a bridge, pending the initiation of chronic-phase drugs ( Figure 1 and Figure 4). Furthermore, at this stage, examinations such as simple radiography to assess joint damage may be requested. In addition, musculoskeletal ultrasonography may be useful for differentiating between joint and periarticular alterations and edema of vascular origin (useful also in the acute and post-acute phases), helping to identify other ligament or tendon injuries or erosions, and evaluating the intensity of inflammation.
